div.p: REAR VAULT (Fr. arriere voussure), the term in architecture employed for the vault of the internal hood of a doorway or window to which a splay has been given on the reveal; sometimes the vaulting surface is terminated by a small rih known as the scoinson rib ( q.v .), and a further development is given by angle shafts carrying this rib, known as scoinson shafts.
